name: Mahekal Beach Resort

reviews.text: I was a little concerned about encountering noise problems after reading some of the reviews here, but we were placed far away from the construction and heard very little of it. Security was on top of any excessive noise late at night. Staff was so friendly and helpful. Breakfast is good with fresh fruits and eggs, etc. Dinner is OK -- for mass-produced food, it's as expected. I wouldn't plan on eating every meal there. You should travel into Playa del Carmen and sample some of the restaurants there. I highly recommend Yaxche Restaurant for regional mayan cuisine.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.text: If you want to stay somewhere away from the concrete jungle of all inclusives and try somewhere genuinely charming and relaxing, then stay at the Shagri-La, you'll love it.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Our family came to Playa Del Carmen with another family and had a fabulous time, we did not want to leave the Shangri-La!
reviews.title: Beautiful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first we were a little cautious about the semi all-inclusive factor.
reviews.title: Robinson Curusoe

likes.liked: — Beach front and differnt type of property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Your stay includes breakfast and dinner but no beverages at all, with the exception of bottled water refreshed daily in your room. We stayed in one of the beach front cabins. We thought we had booked our rooms side by side but when we arrived they told us this wasn't possible. They did eventually move us without any hassle at all 4 days later when the room became available.
reviews.title: Closest thing to paradise
An Honest Review by a Hotel Manager on vacation
reviews.text: First off, let me tell you that I am hard to impress and love to stay in 5 diamond properties. While the Shangri-La Caribe would not typically meet a 5 diamond award I think it authenticity and location give it that grade.

Here are some things to think about when considering this Hotel. This property is beachfront, that is a plus for access. There are many options for rooms, some have a lot of foot traffic passing them by others are remote and secluded. Be sure that you are asking for the exact room type that will make you happy. We started in 30P which is a penthouse at the far end of the property beside the mexican beach. It was up three flights of stairs, which was great because the exercise allowed us to eat a bit more! The room was fantastic, king bed, lots of space open air to a view and the breeze. For the last half we stayed in 5c a cabana right on the beach. Walk out the front door to your beach spot. The beachfront cabana can be noisy at night because people pass by having fun. There is ample security checking the grounds at all times. They move people along as quickly as possible...but it you are a light sleeper you may wish a different location. But then again, you'd miss out on the sounds, sights and smells of staying right on the beach!
reviews.title: Would definitely go back!
Another lovely stay in Playa
reviews.text: There are no hairdryers in the suites and amenities are sparse, sheets are standard not 300 thread count and no plush mattresses...but everything in the rooms is clean and comfortable..so no worries..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is satisfactory, but we didnt eat at the Hotel that much..because there are so many fantastic restaurants close by to experiences. Stroll down 5th avenue and thise choices are endless. Drink prices at the Hotel are pricey...we bought a cooler and drinks at walmart and a cooler and shipped it back home with us. well worth it. The Hotel should consider buying some small fridges for the rooms because they have the space. There are no phones or televisions in the rooms. The lack of a phone has its pluses and minuses...but you do get your exercise...All of the staff are friendly and well trained...great dive shop, nice pools, well maintained yards, good cleaning staff, nice food and beverage servers....overall I can't find anything to discredit this great Hotel. One of our favorite spots close to the Hotel is the Cuevo del chango...this is a great spot for a breakfast alternative...
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
Great laid back hotel, felt like Gilligans Island
reviews.text: The hotel is expensive but worth it.

We love this place and will return because it is like paradise. And as the huge condo buildings continue to gobble up all the space around it, Shangri La feels even more precious. We love the waiters, the nicest, most professional of anyplace we've stayed in the world. It was actually a joy to see them in the morning and talk with them about their families, etc. And the resort is as gorgeous as ever! No complaints at all, but it is not fancy.
reviews.title: will go back again, but..........

reviews.text: I do wish that there was a sign posted that infants in diapers may not use the hot tub. The infants and young children seem to have claimed it as their own, crowding out the adults who might want to use it. The bacteria level is probably pretty high since the temperature fosters more bacteria growth. I never saw a child in the kiddie pool the whole time I was there!
reviews.title: Wonderful, unique place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fifth Avenue is a wonderful street and we love to walk it each night. We found a number of excellent restaurants that were not like US chains. Pettit Marrakesh serving Moroccan food (Calle Corazon) was a favorite and we liked the French restaurant on the same block. The Italian restaurant Riviera served fresh and tasty pastas, fish, and more. It's closer to Shangri La than some of the others so the street is not as crowded. For authentic Mexican fare, try La Cueva del Chango just a block up from the resort. It's great fun on Sundays when the locals are there, does not feel touristy at all. And if you are adventurous, there is a Mayan restaurant as well that is interesing as well as delicious.
reviews.title: Quite Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are return visitors who have a favorite room, which happens to be one of the most expensive rooms there. However, it was right next to the construction and we had, yes I really mean it, a chain saw going for three days straight. Another room was offered to us, but we did not want to move, asking instead for one free night (out of 10 there). No go. And, in contrast to the wait staff and bartenders, the front desk was surly, unhelpful and seemed not to care. To be fair, though, in contrast to another writer's experience, the concierge was quite helpful and gladly booked our dinner reservations.
reviews.title: Very unique

likes.liked: — The location and beauty of the resort and beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We missed the old on-site restaurant that allowed one to eat lunch outside, but I heard that when the hurricane blew it away, the decision was made not to re-build it. I don't know if that is true or not, but I much preferred eating outside to eating in the breakfast room.
reviews.title: "Paradise"..can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was just what we were looking for to celebrate our anniversary. It's right on the beach. Though the beach was smaller it was the nicest stretch of beach north of the Ferry pier...our opinion. We had a penthouse on the playa side that offered privacy. This is perfect for a special occasion. We would stay here again if we were in Playa for a special occasion.
reviews.title: Perfect for a special occasion

likes.liked: — Large enough to have extras but not so large to be impersonal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all wonderful and very friendly.
reviews.title: Heaven

likes.liked: — Beach location, wait staff, food, hammocks

reviews.text: The only drawbacks were; dinner was included...we never had dinner there. Most days our room was not cleaned until the 3 oçlock hour.
reviews.title: Wonderful !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful way to spend our honeymoon! This place was so relaxing after a week here you know you've had a holiday. We were skeptical of inclusive hotels but this the perfect arrangement. The wait staff here are the best I've ever seen. Attention to detail and personalised service make you feel special without feeling over pampered and you certainly do not feel like you are part of a production line. With breakfast and dinner included we thought it might get a bit much but I assure you the food is to die for! We stayed in a Garden View room and whilst considered the entry level here we would choose it again. Whilst not right on the beach we were only a short walk but then far enough away if we wanted some peace and quite to lay in the hammock on our own verandah. Not to mention the property is only an easy walk (10-15min) from all the action of Play del Carmen, but far enough away to have an uncrowded beach. Whilst it is a great place for couples there were a few guests there with small children and we noticed how fantastic the staff were with kids. The rooms do not have a fridge and this was the only down side if you wanted to purchase your own drinks. There was a shop 3 minutes away so it wasn't far to stock up if we needed supplies.
reviews.title: Will Return

likes.liked: — The property is unique, clean, on a nice beach, and close to town.
likes.disliked: — Lots of children. Was suprised that parents would bring small children. The food choices at dinner are limited, no activities for kids, pools small, and if in strollers there is sand everywhere.

reviews.text: I have lived and traveled in Mexico extensively but hadn't been to the Riviera Maya in a number of years. I found the Shangri-la through Trip Advisor and books. My family and I agree it is one of the best vacations we have ever had. The hotel was absolutely delightful. The small size of the resort definitely beats out the giant all inclusives nearby. Our rooms in the Pueblito section were like staying in a child's treehouse. Everything was clean and kept up. The food was good and the staff were helpful and friendly. The close proximity to Playa del Carmen means that you are not trapped out in the country. A nice touch for my 10 yr. old was the pottery painting. Thanks to Miguel and his compadre at breakfast and dinner. Finally although transportation is plentiful do not hesitate to drive. I drove to Chichen Itza, Tulum and Xel-ha and found driving in this part of Mexico organized and safe. Thanks Trip Advisor Reviewers !
reviews.title: 2nd trip just as good as the 1st trip!!

aka: Mahekal Beach Hotel Playa Del Carmen
description: The Mahékal Beach Resort is a legendary resort village located on 800 feet of white sand beach in the heart of vibrant Playa del Carmen. It has 121 thatched roof, palapa-style bungalows within steps of Fifth Avenue, the celebrated entertainment, shopping, and restaurant district of Playa del Carmen.The thousands of loyal repeat guests at Mahékal Beach Resort describe it as magical, memorable, and authentically Yucatecan. Our style is friendly and relaxed, a unique Caribbean experience where you can rock gently in a hammock on your private terrace and enjoy undoubtedly the best beach in Playa. Our guests love the fact that we have never compromised our truly unique ambiance and style. In keeping with that style, our rooms do not offer television, radios or telephones. Instead, they feature original, brightly colored, Mexican tile bathrooms, private terraces with hammocks for siestas and star gazing, and locally-crafted Mexican wood furniture in an outdoor seating area where you can enjoy our magical sanctuary.
